latest_update.description: The ibm_watsonx_ai Python SDK has been updated to version 1.0. This release includes significant refactoring and cleanup for improved code readability and performance. Key changes include a new authorization method using the 'Credentials' class, easier project and space setup during APIClient initialization, and the relocation of foundation model functions under the 'client.foundation_models' object. Note that some breaking changes and deprecations have been introduced. Please refer to the V1 Migration Guide for detailed information.

v1_migration_guide.refactor_and_cleanup: Major refactoring and cleanup of the codebase for improved readability and performance.
v1_migration_guide.new_authorization: Introduced the 'Credentials' class to replace the credentials dictionary for authentication.
v1_migration_guide.easier_project_and_space_setup: Simplified initialization of APIClient with direct setting of default project or space.
v1_migration_guide.foundation_model_functions_moved: Foundation model functions are now accessible under the 'client.foundation_models' object.
v1_migration_guide.breaking_changes: The 'client.<resource>.list()' methods now return pandas.DataFrame instead of printing tables. Deprecated methods and parameters from v0 have been removed. 'client.credentials' and 'client.wml_credentials' now return a 'Credentials' object. Parameter changes in 'service.score(...)'.
v1_migration_guide.deprecations: Initializing APIClient with a dictionary for credentials is deprecated. Parameters with 'wml' in the name are deprecated. 'uid' has been replaced by 'id'.
